Main usage of harmonizR V3

2023-02-01

Source: vignettes/Main-usage-of-harmonizR_V3.Rmd
Main-usage-of-harmonizR_V3.Rmd

Introduction

This vignette is a first step into the harmonizRv3 to facilitate the data harmonization process. The package follows Maelstrom Research approach and standards. It is heavily built on [insert name of Maelstrom toolbox package here] and fabR.

For more information about Maelstrom Research, see here.

Bellow is a walkthrough of the harmonization process using the package harmonizRv3 and established harmonization rules. It shows how to:

  • Explore datasets prior to harmonization
  • Generate bookdown reports of study-specific variables
  • Read and interpret the data processing elements (harmonization potential and data processing rules) to generate harmonized dataset(s)
  • Generate bookdown reports of harmonized variables

Please note that all the demo files mentioned below are downloadable on an Opal demo environment.

Get started

To download our package, you need to have an account on GitHub and create a secure key (in the format “ghp_xxx”).

You can send us your Github name using the following link so we can add you to our authorized list of users.

# To update the R package in your R environment you may first need to remove it, 
# and use the exit command quit() to terminate the current R session.

# To install the R package:
devtools::install_github(
  repo = "https://github.com/maelstrom-research/harmonizRv3",
  auth_token = "ghp_xxx",,
  force = TRUE)
library(harmonizRv3)
# additional packages needed for this demonstration
library(tidyverse)
library(opalr)
library(utils)
library(fabR)

#if you need help with the package, please use:
harmonizR_help()

Import demonstration files

To test and use the library harmonizRv3, you can get access to demo files that are downloadable in our Opal demo site. Do not hesitate to contact us using the form previously mentioned above.

o <- opal.login(username = 'administrator',
                password = 'password',
                url = 'https://opal-demo.maelstrom-research.org/')

opal_files_pull(o, from = "/home/administrator/DEMO_V8_harmonizRv3/data_processing_elements", to = "DEMO")
opal_files_pull(o, from = "/home/administrator/DEMO_V8_harmonizRv3/dataschema", to = "DEMO")
opal_files_pull(o, from = "/home/administrator/DEMO_V8_harmonizRv3/individual_study_datasets", to = "DEMO")
opal_files_pull(o, from = "/home/administrator/DEMO_V8_harmonizRv3/taxonomy", to = "DEMO")

opal.logout(o)
rm(o)

Index files for harmonization

Create a tibble listing all files in a folder (recursively) with some useful metadata. You can add a filter to your query to exclude folders from indexing. This tibble can also be used to quickly search for the location of a file. Finally, you can read the indexed files and generate objects in the R environment.

Indexation is not necessary but facilitate the handling of the input data and documents.


# create index of files that are in a  folder
index_DEMO <- file_index_create(folder = "DEMO")

# search index for files matching a specific file path query
file_index_search(index = index_DEMO, file_path = "study_specific")

# read the files and assign them into a list
demo_data <- file_index_read(index = index_DEMO, file_path = "individual_study_datasets/DEMO_study_specific_datasets")
demo_datadict <- file_index_read(index = index_DEMO, file_path = "DEMO_study_specific_datadictionaries")
demo_dataschema <- file_index_read(index_DEMO, file_path = "dataschema")
demo_dpe <- file_index_read(index_DEMO, file_path = "data_processing_elements")

Harmonize

harmonizRv3 requires specific inputs to achieve the harmonization process, and includes many validation of the inputs provided.

The general process involves to:

  • Associate dataset(s) and their data dictionary
  • Group dataset(s) in a study object
  • Harmonize a study using the data schema and data processing element
  • Review the harmonized study

When you have no errors, this is straigthforward. The first step is to prepare the datasets:

# associate metadata from data dictionnary to the the data
dataset_MELBOURNE_1 <- data_dict_apply(data = demo_data$dataset_MELBOURNE_1,
                                       data_dict = demo_datadict$dd_MELBOURNE_1_format_maelstrom)
dataset_MELBOURNE_2 <- data_dict_apply(data = demo_data$dataset_MELBOURNE_2,
                                       data_dict = demo_datadict$dd_MELBOURNE_2_format_maelstrom)
dataset_PARIS <- data_dict_apply(data = demo_data$dataset_PARIS,
                                 data_dict = demo_datadict$dd_PARIS_format_maelstrom)
dataset_TOKYO <- data_dict_apply(data = demo_data$dataset_TOKYO,
                                 data_dict = demo_datadict$dd_TOKYO_format_maelstrom_tagged)


# group the datasets in a study object
# NB: the name of the datasets in the study must match the column ss_table in the data processing element
study_ALL <- study_create(list(dataset_MELBOURNE_1, dataset_MELBOURNE_2, dataset_PARIS, dataset_TOKYO))
# harmonization
harmonized_ALL <- harmo_process(study = study_ALL,
                                dataschema = demo_dataschema$DEMO_dataschema,
                                data_procelem = demo_dpe$`DEMO_data_processing_elements - final`)

# assess the harmonization
harmonized_ALL_eval <- harmonized_study_evaluate(harmonized_ALL)
harmonized_ALL_eval$`Mlstr::pooled_harmonized_dataset` #identify errors and potential issues

# produce summary statistics of the data
harmonized_ALL_summary <- harmonized_study_summarise(harmonized_ALL)
write_excel_allsheets(harmonized_ALL_summary$`Mlstr::pooled_harmonized_dataset`[-1],
                      filename = "DEMO/harmonized_summary.xls") # Save summary as Excel

# generate visual report
harmonized_study_visualize(harmonized_ALL, to="DEMO/VISUAL/harmonized")
open_visual_report("DEMO/VISUAL/harmonized/") # open the report in browser

Assess inputs and errors

The harmonizRv3 package also includes functions to assess the data and inputs of the harmonization. Functions ending by “_evaluate” identify errors [ERR] and warn of potential issues [INFO]. Functions ending by “_summary” produce descriptive statistics of the data. Visualization of the distribution of the data can also be produced using “_visualize” functions.

Data dictionnaries:

data_dict_evaluate(demo_datadict$`dd_TOKYO_format_maelstrom_tagged - ERROR WITH DATA`)

data_dict_evaluate(demo_datadict$`dd_TOKYO_format_maelstrom_tagged - ERROR`)

data_dict_evaluate(demo_datadict$dd_TOKYO_format_maelstrom_tagged)

Datasets:

# Create a dataset with errors
dataset_TOKYO_errors <- data_dict_apply(data = demo_data$`dataset_TOKYO - ERROR WITH DATA`,
                                        data_dict = demo_datadict$`dd_TOKYO_format_maelstrom_tagged - ERROR WITH DATA`)

# Evaluate the dataset
TOKYO_eval <- dataset_evaluate(dataset = dataset_TOKYO_errors)
TOKYO_eval

# Generate a summary and save as Excel file
TOKYO_summary <- dataset_summarize(dataset = dataset_TOKYO_errors)
write_excel_allsheets(TOKYO_summary[-1],
                      filename = "DEMO/TOKYO_summary.xls")

# Generate a visual report
dataset_visualize(dataset = dataset_TOKYO_errors,
                  to = "DEMO/VISUAL/dataset_TOKYO_errors")
open_visual_report("DEMO/VISUAL/dataset_TOKYO_errors/")

Studies:

# Create study with errors
study_ERRORS <- study_ALL
study_ERRORS$dataset_TOKYO <- dataset_TOKYO_errors

# Evaluate the study
study_ERRORS_eval <- study_evaluate(study_ERRORS)
study_ERRORS_eval

# Generate a summary for each datasets in the study
study_ERRORS_summary <- study_summarize(study_ERRORS)

Data schemas:

dataschema_evaluate(demo_dataschema$DEMO_dataschema)

Errors in harmonization

When there are issues in the harmonization, the process is interrupted and a tibble of errors is produced.

# Harmonization with errors in data processing elements
harmonized_ERRORS <- harmo_process(study = study_ALL,
                                dataschema = demo_dataschema$DEMO_dataschema,
                                data_procelem = demo_dpe$`DEMO_data_processing_elements - with error`)
# Show errors
show_harmo_error(harmonized_ERRORS)
harmonized_ERRORS
